result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:38 AM Defendant Deonte Alex Weekley not in court.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck appeared by video for Deonte Alex Weekley.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Limbeck called Deft off the record and left voicemail, no explanation for his non-appearance. State requests bench warrant, cash bond forfeited. Court orders warrant and cash bond forfeited. Court recalls case at 2:54, Deft appears by zoom, stated he had the wrong date. State requests new cash bond be set for 1000.00 and other bond forfeited. Atty Limbeck requests bond be reinstated and requests 500.00 cash bond. Court vacates warrant, takes States request under advisement, does not modify bond at this time. off record 3:04- breakout room for Deft and Attorney. case recalled at 3:23- proceed to prelim hearing. Deft waives right to prelim- hearing, Atty Limbeck will file waiver. Deft waives right to in person appearance. Court- probable cause found, Deft bound over. Defense Rcvd' info waives reading, entered NG pleas.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:15 AM Defendant Deonte Alex Weekley appeared by video.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck appeared by video for Deonte Alex Weekley.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Limbeck recently appointed and has a phone call set up with Deft.
Court notes time limits previously waived and case needs to be set for Preliminary Hearing.
Court puts parties into a breakout room to discuss Preliminary Hearing in order to proceed with scheduling.
08:24 AM - Court recalls
Atty Limbeck spoke w/Deft and would like to schedule Prelim Waiver/Arraignment for next week.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Limbeck is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $50.00 per Month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on September 1, 2022.
$100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.

11:25 AM Defendant Deonte A Weekley in court with attorney Zachary Derksen.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video. Defendant Deonte A Weekley in custody.  Attorney Grant D Scaife appeared for the Wisconsin, State of. Deonte A Weekley appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant advised of rights. Received complaint/waived reading. Preliminary hearing requested. Probable cause found in the complaint. Bond set. Tracking with 22TR1472 & 22TR1473, Guilty plea's entered. Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:00 am.
